$schema.description: A URI identifying the JSONSchema for this event. This should match an schema's $id in a schema repository. E.g. /schema/title/1.0.0

uri.description: Unique URI identifying the event or entity

request_id.description: Unique ID of the request that caused the event

dt.description: UTC event datetime, in ISO-8601 format

domain.description: Domain the event or entity pertains to

stream.description: Name of the stream/queue/dataset that this event belongs in

test_map.description: We want to support 'map' types using additionalProperties to specify the value types.  (Keys are always strings.) A map that has concrete properties specified is still a map. The concrete properties can be used for validation or to require that certain keys exist in the map. The concrete properties will not be considered part of the schema. The concrete properties MUST match the additionalProperties (map value) schema.

prop1.description: prop 1 field in complex array items
